messages.messageBody:
"I am really sorry about this! I thought moonwindstarsky was you
Ren. Sorry."

Well...I suppose all these damn moonwindstarsky and starsuncloud's
ARE a bit confusing!!:)
Glad to clear up the confusion...

Ren

messages.subject: Re: The S word
messages.msgSnippet: I am really sorry about this!  I thought moonwindstarsky was you Ren.  Sorry. ... not
messages.messageBody:
I am really sorry about this! I thought moonwindstarsky was you
Ren. Sorry.





--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Ren Allen"
<starsuncloud@n...> wrote:
> "I sent this message once already. I hope that a moderator would
not
> make a
> statement like this (in 3rd person) about me and then not allow me
> to respond!
>
> Ren said
> "I hope this doesn't sound offensive.
> It sounds like she's implying that her child needs to be pushed
> further out away from her like her dog and go a separate way (maybe
> not too much but something like that)."
>
> NO, Ren didn't say that.
> That was from moonwindstarsky, I believe.
>
> I didn't even get involved in this particular thread actually, so
> I'm not sure how that got linked with MY name...oh well.
>
> I did enjoy reading your clarification though Millie. It sounded
> like you were wanting to push him towards "socializing" and after
> reading further I can see you aren't.
> Maybe if we just say "don't worry, it will come", will that help?:)
>
> Ren

messages.subject: The S word
messages.msgSnippet: I sent this message once already. I hope that a moderator would not make a statement like this (in 3rd person) about me and then not allow me to respond! Ren
messages.messageBody:
"I sent this message once already. I hope that a moderator would not
make a
statement like this (in 3rd person) about me and then not allow me
to respond!

Ren said
"I hope this doesn't sound offensive.
It sounds like she's implying that her child needs to be pushed
further out away from her like her dog and go a separate way (maybe
not too much but something like that)."

NO, Ren didn't say that.
That was from moonwindstarsky, I believe.

I didn't even get involved in this particular thread actually, so
I'm not sure how that got linked with MY name...oh well.

I did enjoy reading your clarification though Millie. It sounded
like you were wanting to push him towards "socializing" and after
reading further I can see you aren't.
Maybe if we just say "don't worry, it will come", will that help?:)

Ren
